intro: Palicourea tenuis, commonly known as the slender palicourea, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its small, opposite leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest in both horticultural and ecological studies.
